resources.string: [sv]This reference app is the starting point for any new patient medical or consumer mobile app. It is made up of configurable common components which are all part of the CDP2 Platform. It will help accelerate your app development, harmonize UX across Philips and ensures appropriate integration with HSDP.

[sv]AppInfra is the components top level module. It gathers all the modules delivered by the AppInfra Common Component into one single structure. AppInfra facilitates dependency injection into common components and other software pieces that make use of the AppInfra functionalities.

[sv]Whenever users find any difficulty in using the app, they can use the Consumer Care feature to get the issues resolved. The app provides a number of ways the users can access Consumer Care support, such as live chat, e-mail, call, tweet, Facebook post, and so on.

[sv]Connectivity feature in Reference App, provides the ability to pair the mobile application with a reference device using Bluetooth capability for capturing the data from the device to the mobile application.

[sv]Data Services is a common component that acts as a gateway to data core. It will provide synchronization with application data base for the below support the following types of data -\nMoments, Consents, Insights, Push notification and user characteristics.

[sv]In App Purchase feature in Reference App, provides the ability to buy products from the app for the users, which would give users the convenience of shopping anytime-anywhere. This approach also will boost marketing and sales.

[sv]Product registration is a common component, which facilitates the user to create/login into My Philips account and Register a Normal Product where by providing CTN Number, Serial Number(Mandatory) and Date of Purchase.
[sv]UI Toolkit is a component that provides UI controls that are present in the designs provided by the design team on all the screens of the mobile application.

[sv]User registration feature in Reference App provides the ability of registering a new user accessing the mobile application, for logging into the application using valid organization social media specific credentials.

[sv]"Special offers, promotions and first hand information about new product releases.
Tailored for you!

Join 140.000 of your peers now!"

[sv]AppInfra is the component\'s top level module. It gathers all the modules delivered by the AppInfra Common Component into one single structure. AppInfra facilitates dependency injection into common components and other software pieces that make use of the AppInfra functionalities.

[sv]Connectivity feature in Reference App, provides the ability to pair the mobile application with a reference device using Bluetooth capability for capturing the data from the device to the mobile application

[sv]Whenever users find any difficulty in using the app, they can use the Consumer Care feature to get the issues resolved. The app provides a number of ways the users can access Consumer Care support, such as live chat, e-mail, call, tweet, Facebook post, and so on.

[sv]UI Toolkit is a component that provides UI controls that are present in the designs provided by the design team on all the screens of the mobile application

[sv]User registration feature in Reference App provides the ability of registering a new user accessing the mobile application, for logging into the application using valid organization / social media specific credentials
[sv]You can make Philips purchases or via 3rd party retailers here.
[sv]You can contact Philips consumer care here. Consumer Care is the destination for all Philips questions, product information and reviews.

[sv]This reference app is the starting point for any new patient medical or consumer mobile app. It is made up of configurable common components which are all part of the CDP2 Platform. It will help accelerate your app development, harmonize UX across Philips and ensures appropriate integration with HSDP.
[sv]Wait..While we fetch your sleep data from device

[sv]ReferenceApp is a base platform used by all propositions to develop and maintain features both generic and specific to the propositions. App infra, Data Gateway, App FWK, and UIToolkit allow Apps to be created from uApps and UI-less services/libraries. ReferenceApp acts as a foundation over which CDP2 uApps and proposition specific uApps are integrated to form individual apps.

[sv]This app integrates the common components required to develop new IoT solutions for acceleration across Philips. It is the first reference for the development of all new patient medical or consumer mobile apps.
[sv]Designers, developers and business leaders across Philips.
[sv]Reference App comprises all of the configurable common components that are part of the CDP2 platform.
[sv]It provides all the reference information and tools needed to accelerate and harmonize UX development and ensure appropriate HSDP integration.
[sv]The UX has been fully approved by Philips Design and will soon be in DLS.
[sv]The complete platform is tagged and delivers data to monitor & improve your proposition.
[sv]The Security & Privacy actions of the complete platform are fully in line with Philips rule.
[sv]Localization of your proposition is enabled by the platform, including China.
[sv]The CDP2 platform is fully integrated with HSDP and IT to ensure all functionalities are enabled end-2-end within the Philips landscape.
Satsspecifik stor text visas i brödtexten
Du har angett eller valt ogiltiga parametervärden. Välj lämpliga parametervärden och starta igen
[sv]I allow Philips to store binary data
[sv]I allow Philips to use my mobile application usage statistics
[sv]I allow Philips to use my data for Coaching purposes
[sv]The actual content of the binary consent help text here
[sv]By revoking consent your data will be deleted from our servers.
Jag tillåter att Philips samlar mina appdata som hjälper till att förbättra programmet, anpassa appen för att integrera med sociala medier och att visa relevant innehåll och annonser.

Cookie-meddelande

Appen använder Adobe Analytics, en analystjänst (Adobe Analytics”) som tillhandahålls av Adobe Software Ireland Limited (”Adobe”). Adobe Analytics använder “cookies” eller liknande teknik, vilket är textfiler placerade i appen för att hjälpa appen att analysera spårmönster via vår app. Genom att överföra den cookie-genererade informationen om användning av appen till Adobe säkerställer inställningen att IP-adressen är anonym före geolokaliseringen och ersätts av en allmän IP-adress före lagring. Å Philips vägnar använder Adobe den här informationen för utvärdering av användning av appen, sammanställning av rapporter om appaktivitet för Philips och för att tillhandahålla andra tjänster i relation till appaktivitet och användning av appen till Philips. Adobe kommer inte att koppla ihop IP-adressen med några andra data som innehas av Adobe. Du kan förhindra Adobes och Philips insamling och användning av data (cookies och IP-adress) om du hoppar av när du har stängt skärmen.
[sv]By revoking consent your data will be deleted from our servers.
[sv]The actual content of the coaching consent help text here
[sv]By revoking consent your data will be deleted from our servers.

Som ett resultat av ditt medgivande kan det hända att Philips företagsgrupp kontaktar dig med marknadsföringsinformation via e-post, SMS och andra digitala kanaler, som mobilappar och sociala media. För att kunna skräddarsy informationen efter dina preferenser och vanor och ge dig den bästa möjliga personliga upplevelsen, kan vi analysera och kombinera dina personliga data. Dessa data kan inkludera: 

Uppgifterna du ger oss
Data som du aktivt vill dela med oss som: namn, födelsedatum eller ålder, e-postadress, besöksadress, land, kön, telefonnummer, profil på sociala medier.

Data som vi får från din interaktion med Philips
Data om dina interaktioner och din användning av Philips digitala kanaler, som sociala medier, webbplatser, e-postmeddelanden, appar och anslutna produkter. Dessa data kan inkludera: IP-adress, cookies, enhetsinformation, meddelanden som du kan klicka i, adressuppgifter och webbplatser du besöker

Philips ger dig möjlighet att när som helst återkalla ditt medgivande.
Mer information finns i Philips sekretessmeddelande och Philips cookie-meddelande.
[sv]The actual content of the moment consent help text here
[sv]By revoking consent your data will be deleted from our servers.
[sv]The actual content of the research and analytics consent help text here
[sv]By revoking consent your data will be deleted from our servers.
[sv]I allow Philips to store my data in cloud
[sv]I allow Philips to use my data for Research and Analytics purposes

[sv]We’ve detected that you have jailbroken and not activated screenlock, thereby making it easier for others to access your data. We recommend enabling your screenlock.
[sv]We’ve detected the screenlock of your mobile phone is to enabled, thereby making it easier for others to access your data. We recommend enabling your screenlock.

Du är inte inloggad. Gå till Inställningar och logga in
[sv]Configuration can only be changed at launch time. You need to relaunch the app to change it.
[sv]I want to share my app data to help improve the app and provide me with personalized services

[sv]Adobe Analytics

This App uses Adobe Analytics, an analytics service ("Adobe Analytics”) provided by Adobe Systems Software Ireland Limited ("Adobe") Adobe Analytics uses "cookies" or similar techniques, which are text files placed in your App, in order to help the App to analyze overall traffic patterns through our App. By transmitting the information generated by the cookie about the use of the App to Adobe, setting ensures that IP address is anonymized before geo-localization und will be replaced by a generic IP address before storage. On behalf of Philips, Adobe will use this information for the evaluation of your use of the App, compiling reports on App activity for Philips, and in order to provide other services relating to App activity and use of the App to IP address with any other data held Philips Adobe will not associate your by Adobe. You can prevent Adobe's and Philips collection and use of data out after you close this screen (cookies and IP address) if you opt-out after you close this screen.

Google Firebase

This App uses Google Firebase, an app development service (Firebase) provided by Google Ireland Ltd ("Google"). Firebase uses cookies or similar techniques- SDK, which are text files placed in your App and web browser.

On behalf of Philips, Firebase will use information from your device such as your Device ID. IP address, your IDFA or Google Play Services ID and your MAC address and replace them with unique code. When you use the App we will measure the numbers of visits to the App, which pages you visit your network connection, load times and when the app crashes. We use this information to evaluate and understand your use of the App, to test and analyze performance and ultimately optimize our products and services.
[sv]Reference app asks for the location permissions so it can better understand your unique lifestyle.
[sv]I allow Neura Sdk to track my moments
[sv]Please go to profile privacy settings and enable neura sdk
[sv]To adapt to your preferences and needs, allow sharing location with Philips and Neura.
[sv]Philips works with Neura to enable tailor-made experience based on your lifestyle and activity levels by enabling location.

[sv]Reference app asks for the location permissions so it can better understand your unique lifestyle. Reference app will adapt and anticipate your needs based on your daily routine to provide the recipes you need at the time you need them.
[sv]How can I improve my sleep score?
